Description.Title: SiriusQuality-SoilTemperature
Description.ExtendedDescription: Computes soil temperature dynamics for crop simulations. It estimates daily minimum and maximum soil surface temperatures from air temperatures and soil heat flux, with a first‑order memory for deep soil temperature initialized from the annual mean air temperature. It can also produce hourly soil temperatures using the Parton & Logan (1981) diurnal formulation. Key parameters include lambda_ (latent heat of vaporization scaling) and a, b, c timing/shape coefficients; key states include maxTSoil, minTSoil, hourlySoilT, and deepLayerT.
Description.ShortDescription: Daily min/max (and hourly) soil temperature from air temperature and soil heat flux with deep-layer smoothing.

Input.name: lambda_
Input.description: Latent heat of water vaporization at 20°C

Function.name: Init
Function.description: Initialization function. Sets the deep soil layer temperature to the annual mean air temperature.

Function.name: Estimate
Function.description: Main process. Computes daily minimum and maximum soil temperature and updates the deep soil layer temperature.

Function.name: SoilMinimumTemperature
Function.description: Computes daily minimum soil temperature as the minimum of SoilTempA and SoilTempB.

Function.name: SoilMaximumTemperature
Function.description: Computes daily maximum soil temperature as the maximum of SoilTempA and SoilTempB.

Function.name: SoilTempA
Function.description: Soil temperature component A using air temperatures, soil heat flux, and latent heat.

Function.name: SoilTempB
Function.description: Soil temperature component B using minimum air temperature and deep soil temperature.

Function.name: UpdateTemperature
Function.description: Updates the deep soil layer temperature from minimum and maximum soil temperatures.
